title: Sri Lanka rupee at 364.7 to TT dollar, interbank rupee at 359.7
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s commercial banks quoted the rupee at 364.7 against telegraphic transfers on Thursday (26) while the central bank interbank spot trade was at 359.7 under a daily.
On Thursday, the central bank guidance margin is plus 2.50 rupees or minus 3.50 rupees.
Commercial banks were quoting 354.7/364.7 for telegraphic transfer dollars on Thursday, remaining unchanged from last week.

Sri Lanka’s central bank governor warned that the country is yet to see its worst economic contraction in its history as its struggling to import goods while industries also warn of raw material shortages.

The central bank stopped quoting day rates on January 23 when the rupee was floated with an interest rate correction after the soft peg collapsed, amid a war. In 2021 and the central bank also started enforcing a rate incompatible with the policy rate at around 203 to the US dollar.
The central bank from August 2021 to April has hiked rates by almost 9 percent and in April alone the rates were hiked by 7 percent.
The secondary market was only moderately active following the previous day’s T-bills auction.
Three-month bills were quoted at around 21.75/22.00 percent in mid-day trade, down from 22.00/22.40 percent on Wednesday.
A bond maturing on 01.06.2025 was quoted around 22.50/22.80 percent, wider from 22.50/22.65 percent on Wednesday.
